definition: (of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)

sentences.english: His father, a shoemaker, had died, and his mother had married again.
sentences.chinese: 他的修鞋匠的父親死了，母親改嫁了。

sentences.english: If you remarry in another situation, regardless of the cultural acceptance of it , you commit adultery .
sentences.chinese: 如果你改嫁另一局面，無論接受它的文化，你淫邪。

sentences.english: In order to live, two years later, mother and married my stepfather.
sentences.chinese: 爲了生活，兩年後母親又改嫁給了我現在的繼父。

sentences.english: At that time her daughter Lin Ke to remarry.
sentences.chinese: 那時林某帶着女兒改嫁到柯家。

sentences.english: Since his death I decided not to remarry or get a child outside my matrimonial home.
sentences.chinese: 他去世了，我不打算改嫁，也不想收養別人的孩子。

sentences.english: And when my mother remarries, l'll invite you to her wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽改嫁的時候，我會邀請你參加婚禮的。

sentences.english: Mother remarried, and things became even more complex for me.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽改嫁了，對我來說，生活變得更加的複雜。

definition: to live as widow/to observe widowhood
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
to stay at home while one's husband is away/grass widow
to take a wife/to get married (man)
